comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
" TRAINING SHIP MERSEY IMPROVED The agents for the White Star line, Dalgety and Co. Ltd. are in receipt of information from Liverpool regarding improvements to the White Star training ship Mersey, now on her way with cadets to Sydney. She has been painted white from stem to stern, and from truck to waterline, with the exception of teak deckhouses. An electric light plant has been installed, and the Mersey enjoys the distinction of being the only sailing ship afloat illuminated by electricity. "
SMH 26/8/1909 p.8 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/15110496 en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mersey_(1894_ship)

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: Its a fabulous photo isn't it! Thanks for the articles beachcomber, what a modern ship - electricity and all!
